Moved the axis2-transports dependency from the parent POM to rampart-integration.
Stripped dependencies that would impose a particular logging implementation on Maven projects depending on Rampart.

1. Removed the ModulePolicyExtension interface from the Rampart module. Rationale: * ModulePolicyExtension is not really implemented since Rampart#getPolicyExtension() only throws an UnsupportedOperationException. * The UnsupportedOperationException causes a misleading error message in wsdl2java (cf. http://markmail.org/thread/3kcjha2fxo2tksey and r748704). * ModulePolicyExtension is part of axis2-codegen and therefore requires a corresponding Maven dependency. Since it is not really used, this is an unnecessary annoyance for Maven projects depending on Rampart. * It causes troubles at runtime. See AXIS2-3213 and AXIS2-4265.
Applying patch for RAMPART-219, thanks Clom
RAMPART-219: Set WSS4J version to 1.5.6, which is now available.

Clean up of rampart-tests POM: * src/test/java was specified both as sourceDirectory and testSourceDirectory; it should be a testSourceDirectory only. * The test-resources directory should be declared as testResource.

Dependency cleanup (1st part): * junit dependency should have test scope. Exception: in rampart-integration, the code in src/main/java also depends on junit. * Added exclusions for transitive dependencies from jaxen. * Removed dependencies on annogen, ant-nodeps and xalan. * Replaced dependency on axis2-transports by dependencies on individual transport implementations so that maven can add the right transitive dependencies. * Removed the explicit dependency on httpcore. This is now a transitive dependency contributed by axis2-transport-http. * The dependency on org.opensaml:opensaml was declared twice: first using version 2.2.3 and then using version 1.1. Since Maven only keeps the last declared version, removed the dependency on 2.2.3. * Removed dependencies on xml-apis and xercesImpl since the target platform is now Java 5. (Note that they still remain transitive dependencies)
Compiling the code twice doesn't make it better: removed testSourceDirectory in those modules where it had the same value as sourceDirectory.

Fix the way OMFactory.createOMNamespace(...) method was used into getDefaultPrefixNamespaces(OMFactory factory) method. The order of "prefix" and "uri" parameters passed was wrong. The first parameter should be the "uri" and the second one the "prefix". Now it is fixed and tested.

Use org.apache:apache:7 as parent POM, so that the build has access to the new Apache snapshot repository. This also makes sure that all artifacts include the appropriate LICENSE and NOTICE files.

Attempt to fix conflicting dependencies between wss4j and opensaml. This in particular should avoid the double dependency on serializer, which I believe is the root cause of the build failures seen in Hudson.

Eliminated the old snapshot repository (on people.apache.org; all snapshot dependencies are now available at repository.apache.org) as well as ws.zones.apache.org. The OpenSAML 1.1 release is available from Maven central, although with a different groupId/artifactId.

The MARs distributed with Axis2 now always use the same Maven version as the other artifacts. Therefore there is no need anymore for the addressing.mar.version property.

Enabling crypto caching by default when Merlin is used as the Crypto implementation. Old parameters used to enable crypto caching are still valid. If someone wants to disable crypto caching, it can be done by setting the value of attribute 'enableCryptoCaching' to false. (This new attribute needs to included to the documentation)
Updating the RampartConfig documentation to cover the disable caching option.
Replaced tabs by spaces.
Added an 'everything' profile that includes all modules.

Fixing RAMPART-317 : Fixing an error when handling bearer subject confirmation.

- Fixing some issues related to Bearer subject confirmation method in SAML 1.1. - Adding support for bearer subject confirmation in SAML 2.0. - Adding a new integration test to cover bearer subject confirmation with SAML 2.0 - Improving the existing SAML 1.0 bearer subject confirmation test.
Adding alias of the certificate used for the signature[in asymmetric binding scenarios] as a msg.ctx property. This also a fix for RAMPART-201
Adding a test case to validate ContentEncryptedElements support.
- Registering HttpsTokenBuilder as a neethi assertion builder. - Adding a null check before processing policy alternatives defined for HttpsTokens to support the <HttpsToken/> assertion.
Fixing the policy file to be compliant with HttpsToken definition of WS-Security Policy 1.2
Fixed a couple of Maven 3 warnings.

Adding support for digest methods != SHA1. Enabled one policy(scenario 3) with Basic256 algo suit (Also set basic256Supported in RampartTest so builds without unlimitted strength key policy won't fail. When wss4j version is updated we can fix derived key signatures to set the correct digest algo
Eliminated a couple of instances of the catch-and-fail JUnit anti-pattern.
Replaced usages of Axiom implementation classes by invocations of the public API.
Replaced usages of Axiom implementation classes by invocations of the public API.
Make use of the API defined by AXIOM-353.

Attempt to get out of the SLF4J dependency hell and to make logging in the integration tests predictable. There is really no sense in having commons-logging, jcl-over-slf4j, log4j-over-slf4j, log4j and slf4j-jdk14 in the class path at the same time and then to configure commons-logging.properties to use SimpleLog. rampart-integration is now set up so that commons-logging and SLF4J both send logs to log4j.
Moved the DOOM dependency to the right module(s).
Fixed an issue that occurs in the outflow when the Axiom implementation also supports DOM.

Avoid the DOM->Axiom conversion if the underlying Axiom implementation supports DOM. Note that this doesn't apply to DOOM (because DOOM is an incomplete implementation of the Axiom API), but to implementations such as DDOM [http://code.google.com/p/ddom/].
Applied patch for RAMPART-326.
Applied patch for RAMPART-327.
Setting correct svn:eol-style on POM files (to avoid spurious changes caused by the maven-release-plugin).
Pushing back r1130011,1130020 from 1.6 branch to the trunk so that site changes will not be lost during the next major release.
Added missing license files and updated release docs.
Updated site for 1.6.0 release
Moved CGI scripts to the right location. They are not XDoc files.
Fixed a problematic Axiom iterator usage.
Removed redundant distributionManagement entries. On the 1.5 branch, this was done in r1055352, but the corresponding commit on the trunk (r1055376) didn't remove it.
Updated Axiom version.
Fixed a couple of incorrect policy documents.
Removed xmlsec as a direct dependency so that it is retrieved as a transitive dependency of WSS4J with the correct version (WSS4J currently uses xmlsec 1.4.5, but Rampart trunk was still at 1.4.2).
Set up log4j to make the unit tests less verbose.
Removed uniqueVersion=false because that option is no longer supported in Maven 3.0.
Removed the unnecessary profile for JDK 1.4.
Removed bcprov-jdk14 from the distribution.

Removed the rampart.mar.version and rahas.mar.version properties. Starting with version 1.5.1, Axis2 supports version numbers with multiple components so that there is no need anymore to have different version numbers for MARs.
Updated dependencies.
Prefer adoptNode over importNode in order to avoid making unnecessary copies of DOM trees.
Fixed typo in artifactId of the documentation module.
Prepared the site for the 1.5.2 and 1.6.1 releases.
Attempt to fix a failure in release:prepare with Maven 2.2.1.
Committing the patch provided by AmilaJ for RAMPART-336.
Applying the patch provided by AmilaJ for RAMPART-334/
Reverted r1177260 because that change actually depends on a bug in DOOM that is now fixed (see r1177407). With that change in Axiom, the problem described in RAMPART-336 no longer occurs.
RAMPART-324: Added the test case provided by Amila Jayasekara, but implemented a proper fix based on the feature added by AXIOM-388.
Eliminated a couple of direct references to DOOM.
Use filtering to automatically replace the version number and build date in the README file. This eliminates a manual step in the release process.
Fixed an incorrect usage of the Axiom API that caused Rampart to depend on the issue described in AXIOM-385.
Fixed the build on older JDK 1.5 versions.
Bootstrap OpenSAML when the Rampart module is initialized, so that the success of the test suite no longer depends on the order in which the tests are executed.
Moved the OpenSAML initialization to the right place, i.e. the init method of the Rahas module.
Replaced tabs by spaces and fixed some other formatting issues.
Use a less hacky solution to make OpenSAML 1 use DOOM: register a custom XML.ParserPool that uses DOOMDocumentBuilderFactory.
Replacing deprecated DOOMAbstractFactory with OMAbstractFactory
Applying Amila's patch for RAMPART-347
Fixing the incorrect prefix issue, reported in some complaints about working with generated code
Fix suggested in RAMPART-350
Getting rid of a possible NPE : Caused when someone forgets to setup RampartConfig
RAMPART-338: Avoid hardcoded module version numbers.
Include an SLF4J binding in the distribution so that the setup task is able to configure Axis2 to support OpenSAML.
Include the Axis2 conf directory in the class path so that log4j is properly configured.
Include the Xerces version expected by OpenSAML in the distribution.
Fixed and simplified some code obviously written by people who lack understanding of the StAX API, and in particular about how XMLStreamWriter#setPrefix works and is supposed to be used.
Fixing issue RAMPART-269. Also added an integration test case
Fixing a build failure with a temperorary code change
Fixed an issue in Rampart that occured because it was implicitly relying on a non-conformance of DOOM's DOM implementation.
Fixing issue RAMPART-354. Upgraded OpenSAML version to 2.5.1-1. Added more unit tests to trust module
Fixing issue RAMPART-355. Upgraded WSS4J version to 1.6.4. Fixed all unit tests and integration tests. Also removed opensaml 1.1 dependency.
Eliminated some direct (compile time) dependencies on DOOM.
Removed unused imports.
Formatting changes. In particular, eliminate unwanted tab characters.
Fixed the logging configuration used by the tests.
Set up svn:ignore for Eclipse.
Get rid of the remaining direct references to DOOM. In particular, removed the DocumentBuilderFactory hacks. Since Amila ported the AxiomParserPool to OpenSAML 2, these hacks are no longer necessary.
Fixed outdated Javadoc.
Refactored SAMLTokenIssuerConfig usages. Reduce code duplication and moved code to a central place. Added tests for SAMLTokenIssuerConfig
Fixing issue RAMPART-357. Applying the patch provided
Propagate exception cause.
Use new Axiom APIs.
Avoid direct references to Axiom implementation classes.
Avoid direct references to Axiom implementation classes.
Refactored SAML2TokenIssuer and cleaned up code. Created a test framework to write unit tests for trust scenarios. Fixed documentation errors. Reduced code duplication. Added more tests.
Fixed few typos and removed unnecessary constant
Avoid unnecessary serialization/deserialization and instead use DOOM directly.
Code simplification: the iterator produced by getChildElements always returns OMElement objects.
Fixed an issue in STSClient: the comment on the code says "Copy over the elements from the template", but it was actually _moving_ the elements.
Fixed unsupported iterator usage.
Fixed invalid resource keys.
Instead of randomly add the assertion to the SOAP envelope (it is later moved to the right place), just specify the owner document, but no parent.
Avoid direct references to Axiom implementation classes.
Eliminated an instance of the catch-and-fail JUnit anti-pattern.
Switched the Rampart trunk to Axiom 1.2.14-SNAPSHOT.
Reverted a change included by mistake in r1311248.
Removing unwanted files from distribution and adding missing dependencies
Applied patch for RAMPART-363.
* Fixed compilation issue due to SAML improvements. * Removed unused imports.
Mavenized Rampart samples so that sample codes will compile during the build, this helps to detect compilation failures on sample.
Replaced tabs by spaces.
Added plugin version to ensure that the build is repeatable.
Added OWASP ESAPI as a dependency to the bin distribution.
Remove license with incorrect name.
Added ESAPI license with correct name.
Updated site for 1.6.2 release.
Fixed SOAP version mismatch.
Eliminated reference to DOOMAbstractFactory.

Permanently ban non Apache repositories. The shibboleth repository was moved and this broke the build. Don't allow this to happen again in the future. Note that all required artifacts are in Maven central (thanks to the efforts of the WSS4J project).
RAMPART-358: Fixed the security fault detection code.
Removed two image files (logos) that are not used (and that are missing the TM).
Added TM to the Rampart logo.
Eliminated usage of deprecated Axiom class.
Moved to new Axiom snapshot version.
Fixed RAMPART-384

- sample01 now runs with the axis2server as expected to demonstrate the use of a UsernameToken. - Added some more documentation into README.txt including some that I found in [1] to make things clearer to the user.

Fixed the issue raised in this [1] discussion. RampartUsernameTokenValidator overrides the verifyPlaintextPassword method of org.apache.ws.security.validate.UsernameTokenValidator The default implementation expects the callback handler to supply the plain text password (when a username token with a plain text password is used), which should not be possible in practice.

The user exception here is simply used as a flag to indicate success or failure of authentication. There's no need to associate any information that the user includes in the user's exception, in the exception generated by Rampart.
Validating password type included in the username token
Validate the NoPassword case

Removing the deprecated basic configuration (This was deprecated since version 1.1). Excluded the Rahas tests from the integration tests to update them to work with policy configuration. Removed basic configuration test cases. Added WS-SecurityPolicy 1.2 namespace to supported policy namespaces in the module.xml
Small change to make JaCoCo work.
Additional check and avoiding an NPE
Reverting changes in revision 1441298

Instrument the tests with JaCoCo to get code coverage reports. Note that this is not yet working as expected because the root/parent POM declares dependencies; they interfere with the code-coverage module.
Eliminate the dependencies from the root/parent POM and move them to the appropriate modules.
Use axis2-repo-maven-plugin to build the test repositories; it does a better job of handling dependencies.
Also copy the axis2.xml file using axis2-repo-maven-plugin.
Applied patch provided in RAMPART-400 by Nathan Clement
1.) Added support in security policy processing for EncryptedToken and SignatureToken : http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/ws-securitypolicy-1.2-spec-os.html#_Toc161826559
license header added to the new files.
1.) Removed the deprecated basic configuration from Rahas (WS-Trust) test cases and updated them to work with policy 2.) Minor code fixes to use generics
These files are not required anymore since we use the policy config with rahas tests
Removed the deprecated basic configuration
- Making sure UsernameTokens are only encrypted when required. - Removed some deprecated methods. - Some more code fixes to use generics.
Switch to Basic128 algo suite to make sure the build won't fail without unlimitted strength crypto policy
Committed a change that was missing in r1455697.
Use standard Maven project layout (with resources in src/main/resources).
Added the Apache snapshot repository as a plugin repository to allow the build to load the expected version of the axis2-repo-maven-plugin.
Upgraded to a recent version of the maven-site-plugin to make it work with Maven 3.
Added missing content.

Fixed download pages for archived released (or releases that are expected to be archived: 1.6.1 should have been archived, but it wasn't). In particular, mirror selection is not relevant for archived releases.
Use a more standard approach to generate the site: * Generate the site from the root POM, not from a submodule. * Avoid using antrun plugin to generate Javadocs.
Set up configuration for maven-scm-publish-plugin.
Use the feather logo/banner from www.apache.org instead of our own copy, which doesn't have the TM sign.
Some changes to ensure that the Rampart site conforms to the Apache branding guidelines.
